intro: Alsodeia floribunda, commonly known as the clustered alsike, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pods. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Alsodeia floribunda is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a valuable plant in ecological restoration projects.
